result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Alan Freiberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (8th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Fine in amount of zero.
Pay the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements.  Monies to be taken by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance would be then be paid while on Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.

superMiscConds.notes: AODA assessment, treatment if needed.  Random urine screens to ensure compliance.  No controlled substances or alcohol.

supervisions.notes: To commence upon eligibility to reinstate license.
To comence upon eligibility to reinstate license.
Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

Provide DNA sample  to Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing, pay surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; also advised his voting rights are suspended and may  not vote in any election untilh is civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Alan Freiberg

15RM027643  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06/03/2015
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Mark Alan Freiberg in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Mark Alan Freiberg in custody.  Ronald Dague for Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug tests, portable breathalyzers and SCRAM

Defendant Mark Alan Freiberg in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Mark Alan Freiberg in custody.  
David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.
